name: Halloween Haunt UP
description:
Have some haunted Halloween fun!

Enjoy buskers and live music, tasty treats, sidewalk sale, costume contest for kids and pets, pumpking carving face painting and more!

name: We're Coming Home
description:
Discover recent works by artist Young Hee Sung in her signature style, Brush Densityism, which layers dense, rhythmic brushstrokes to reconstruct scenes of city life and everyday reality. These images hold memories and belonging, as well as abstract, universal themes like mortality, loneliness and the human spirit. Set against streets, highways and natural landscapes, Sung's work reflects a search for meaning in the present and explores deep connections between the individual, community, city and human existence.

Join the artist for the Opening Reception on Sunday, October 26, from 1 to 3 p.m.

name: Songs of the Forest
description:
Owls, foxes, and bears, oh my! 

Go on a journey into enchanting storybook moments with charming songs, narration, and beautiful imagery that tell the tales of different forest critters. Join us for a captivating Choral Story Hour that offers adults and children alike a chance to share in the storytelling power of live choral music, performed by children, for children and for the child in all of us.

name: AFRICA VIBES: Rooted and Rising

location.name: George Brown College, Casa Loma Campus

description:
Join us as we welcome Chenise Mitchell, who will guide participants through Jazz and its deep connections to African dance and rhythms and Lua Shayenne, who has been deeply engaged in intensive training this year and is eager to share her growth and passion for West African dance. 

This season offers a unique opportunity to learn, connect, celebrate the roots and evolution of dance.

name: Bats, Rats, and Moths, Oh My! A Not So Spooky Nature Walk
description:
Who comes out after we go to bed? Can you hear the bats flying overhead, or the haunting who? who? of the owls? What was that rustle in the bushes? It's not so spooky once you learn what everything is!

For participants ages four and up.
